intro: Tragia arnhemica, commonly known as the Arnhem tragia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of northern Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its leaves are ovate and often have a velvety texture, while its fruits are capsule-like structures that split open to release seeds. Tragia arnhemica is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
